newsitem.title: ISRAEL: Israel Treasury to propose 164.4 bln shekel budget.
newsitem.headline: Israel Treasury to propose 164.4 bln shekel budget.

text.p: The Israeli Treasury will ask the cabinet when it convenes on Sunday to approve a 1998 state budget of 164.4 billion shekels, said an advance copy of a Treasury document released on Friday.
The document said the Treasury will ask the cabinet to set the 1988 budget deficit at 8.5 billion shekels or 2.4 percent of the Gross Domestic Product (GDP) exclusive of credit.

In order to encourage growth, the document went on, there must be a continued decline in the deficit in relation to GDP, a reduction in public expenditure, no tax increase and preferably a cut in the tax burden.
The Treasury will also place before the cabinet a notice informing members that the inflation rate target for 1998 will be between 7-10 percent, the same as 1997.

The proposals come as the cabinet prepares to discuss the 1988 state budget. The cabinet will meet once again on August 31 to vote on a budget package before it is presented to the Israeli parliament for approval no later than December 31.
